The Honorable John Pastore
United States Senate Building

Dear Senator Pas to re*
This letter Is addressed to yon In your capacity as
Chairman of the Subcommittee of the Senate Committee on
Interstate and Foreign Commerce and refers to the hear¬
ings now under way cm Bill S-2834 Introduced by Senator
Smathera.
The university of Michigan has it® own University
Press. Prom time to time the University Press publishes
original music. The University also has its own educa¬
tional radio station, WUOM. If this bill would prohibit
an educational institution which has a broadcasting li¬
cense from publishing music such action would have a ser¬
ious and, X am certain, unintended effect on university
presses throughout the nation.
This letter is not sent you to take a stand on the
other merits of the pending bill, but to inform you and
the Subcommittee of the possible effeot which the pres¬
ent language of the bill would have In hampering the scope
and activities of the University of Michigan Press. I
hope the Committee will see fit to amend it in such a way
as to exclude this possibility.
Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,
LMN/vh
Lyle M. Nelson, Director
University Relations
